stories.headline: International CAR: Around the globe
stories.summary: A report on the growth of computer-assisted reporting (CAR) globally, highlighting issues of access to electronic information and successful projects in various countries.

stories.headline: School Test Scores: Lake Wobegon effect
stories.summary: An investigation into the consistently above-average test scores in Tennessee schools, questioning the validity of the state's claims against national testing standards.

stories.headline: Political Census in Venezuela
stories.summary: A novel journalistic approach to understanding political candidates' perspectives during rapid political changes in Venezuela, involving a comprehensive pre-election survey.

stories.headline: Denmark: Making CAR progress
stories.summary: Describes the growth of CAR practices in Denmark, including the establishment of an association to promote electronic data access among journalists.

stories.headline: Sweden: White collar crime
stories.summary: An investigative television segment revealing inefficiencies in Sweden's costly efforts to combat financial crime, highlighting prosecutions of minor offenses.

stories.headline: Nursing Homes: Going beyond OSCAR
stories.summary: An investigation into nursing homes in Ohio, revealing system flaws through a comprehensive use of various data sources beyond the OSCAR reports.
